About Tabletop Whale

The author

Hi! My name's Eleanor Lutz and I write this blog. I'm a designer in Seattle and I have a Bachelor's in molecular biology from the University of Washington. I used to work in a research lab teaching mosquitoes to fly through mazes.

I spend my free time cooking, reading, playing computer games, and dabbling in frontend web design. Someday I want to write a science fiction book and visit Iceland.

How it's made

I make my infographics and charts in Photoshop and Illustrator, usually with a Wacom drawing tablet. I try to be really transparent about my sources, and most of the infographics are based on reputable scientific sources like textbooks and peer-reviewed research papers. The website is a responsive Jekyll theme built from scratch and hosted on Github Pages.

Copyright information

You can share my infographics almost anywhere as long as you aren't using them to make money. They're licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives 4.0 International License. You also need to attribute the infographic to TabletopWhale.com or to Eleanor Lutz. Shoot me an email if you're unsure if you can use something.

Contact

Want to tell me about an awesome research study? Collaborate on an infographic? Ask me a question or leave a comment? Get in touch at lutze@uw.edu.

About Tabletop Whale

Tabletop Whale is a tiny blog run by a designer in Seattle. It's updated every two to three weeks with a science themed infographic, chart, or illustration.

Say Hi!

Questions? Comments? Feel free to shoot me an email or find me on Twitter. I also have accounts on Dribbble and Behance.
